Entry.1:
Left on leave for Cairo & Luxor.

Hours flown up to date are,

Trips over line – 156 h. 2 m.

Odd flights – 6h. 15m.
Entry.2:
Sent things Home,

Gold bangle - 1.17.0

Gold broche – 1.10.0
Entry.6: Left Cairo for Palestine after a very good holiday. Had a very quiet time.
Entry.7: Arrived at Belah bridge, worked away over Waddy Guzzieh so flew back in a 2E. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 32 min.
Entry.9:
Escort to bombing at El-Kataini on the Hejaz railway. B.F. `Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 hours 45 min., engine very bad, nearly cut out.

Fired 150 rounds at troops in station.
Entry.10:
Cinametrograph man in attendance. I appear in several films. Played golf. Did round in 65. 5, 8, 5, 8, 10, 7, 5, 10, 6.

Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 30 min., cinema trip.
Entry.11:
Recco Jericho

Pilot Capt. Addison.

In air 2 h. 15 m.

Uneventful.

Played golf in afternoon, very bad. 7, 7, 8, 10, 10, 8, 7, 6, 6 – 69.
Entry.12:
Recco Tul Keram.

Pilot Capt. Addison, a B.F.

In air 2 h. 15 m. A good trip.

Engine cut out near Jaffa & nearly let us down in the sea. Did a good recco. Tracer shell fire from Ramin station. Feel awfully well, glad to be at work again.
Entry.14: Recco, Huivarah & Jericho. Pilot Capt. Addison in B.F. In air 2 h. 30 m. Operations against Jericho start today. Started at day break and did important recco. Obtained good information. Played golf, did the 9 holes in 60.
Entry.15:
Orderly Officer.

Escort to bomb raid to E. of Jordan. Raid carried out in rain squalls and mist, machine-gunned Turks transport from 1500 ft., had good sport.

Garson lands and has serious crash.

Pilot Capt. Addison in a B.F., in air 2 h. 35 m., fired 500 rounds.
Entry.16: Recco, Huivarah & Jericho. Pilot Capt. Addison in a B.F. In air 2 h. 30 min. Operations against Jericho start today.
Entry.19:
Inspection by General Chevaul .

Wet, no flying.
Entry.23: Recco, Tul Keram. B.F. Pilot Lt. Lukis. In air 2 h. An uneventful recco, very cloudy.
Entry.24: Recco – Amman. Pilot Lt. Taylor. In air 2 h. 20 m. Did a good recco.
Entry.26:
On photos. First time. B.F. Pilot Lt. Lukis. In air 2 h. 30 m.

Camera jammed after taking one box. Own fault.
Entry.29:
Recco, Tul Keram. B.F. Pilot Lt. Fraser. Returned dud engine, in air 35 m.

Started in another machine, in air 2 h. 30 m. engine very bad indeed. Congratulated on work done. Report on railway bridges.
Entry.30:
Recco. Es Salt-Nablus, in air 2 h. 50 m.

Pilot Lt. Headlam. B.F. A good recco but very cloudy.

Got an anti-aircraft shell extremely close but no damage done.
Entry.31:
Recco Es Salt, Nablus.

Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 h. 45 m. A good trip.

Reported cavalry in Jordan valley.

It is a pleasure to be flying with Addie again.
Entry.35: Escort to bomb raid on pontoon bridge over Jordan, raid unsuccessful but we fired 500 rounds at camps and cavalry with good effect, height 2500. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 2 h. 15 m.
Entry.37:
Recco Tul Keram the 19th. Pilot Lt. Taylor. In air 2 h. Dropped message from Hun observer on Nablus.

Archies severe and accurate, propeller and top plane shot through.

Capt. Austin & Oliver Lee in B.F. Capt. Evans in a Martinside missing. A chance that they may turn up later on.
Entry.38: Events for this date written on last page.
Entry.39:
Oliver still missing.

Recco – Photos, took 44 plates, took photo of gun positions reported by me a week ago.

Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 2 h. 40 m.

Photos were successful.
Entry.41:
Recco, Damie bridge, Es Salt. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 1 hr. 30 m., returned owing to clouds. Started again, in air 2 h. 40 m., clouds very bad but did part of recco.

Total hours,

Reccos – 193 h. 57 m.

Odd trips – 7 h. 17 m.

Total – 201 h. 14 m.
Entry.42:
Oliver Lee still missing. Fear that he is a prisoner so hope that he has come to no worse harm. No news at all about them.

Miss Oliver very much as we were great pals and shared a tent for 6 months.
Entry.43:
Recco at 6 a.m. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 3 h. 20 m., Nablus, Damie, Es Salt, Amman.

A most trying trip through thick clouds. A very difficult time in clouds and big bumps. The worst trip I have had so far. Addie flew well.
Entry.45:
Recco, to start from Jericho, landed at Jericho but recco not done owing to clouds. Jericho a very small place and not very interesting.

Pilot Lt. Headlam, in air 2 h. 20 m.
Entry.46: Recco, Katiani. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 3 h. 30 m. Got a direct hit on a body of 200 cav. with a 20 lb. bomb, caused a tremendous scatter and stampede. Very pleased with result. Also fired 200 rounds at same target.
Entry.48:
Recco. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 3 h. 10 m. Engine cut out on one side over Damie. Reached Jericho.

Visited the Jordan, very interesting and quite a pretty place.

Took off to do recco. Great storm comes up, we turn for home and fly through rain and mist for 1½ hours over the hills round Jerusalem, at times doing 110 m.p.h. and badly raining.
Entry.49: At last news is received of Oliver Lee through a German wireless which states that 3 aviators have been captured near Kataani . Sure to be the three pilots that are missing, very pleased to get this news.
Entry.51: false – refers to officers captured in Mesopotamia.
Entry.52: Escort to bomb raid. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 3 h. 5 m. A good trip to Amman, fired 500 rounds at troop train and Amman station at height of 1000 to 2000 ft., train put on steam and went like the Devil.
Entry.53:
Trip to Keikit Deran in our 2E 
Pilot
 to drop a message, pilot Lt. Murphy, in air 40 m.
Entry.54:
Letters from Home.

On photos, with Addie. In air 2 h. 5 m., did not make a very good job of them, my first trip with large camera, am going out again tomorrow and will make a better job of it.
Entry.55: Cloudy, no photos. Letters from Home. Wrote Mother, Mrs. Howey, Mrs. G. Lee.
Entry.56:
Photos. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 3 h. 35 m. A good got a good lot of photos, very successfull. They were very important as they were wanted to complete map.

News from Hun prisoner that Oliver Lee is a prisoner and safe.
Entry.57:
Hun Aircraft Patrol. Pilot Eustace Headlam, in air 2 h. 55 m.

We met no Huns.

An R.E. 8 was shot down by a Hun today.

Our first success for many weeks.
Entry.58:
Hun Aircraft Patrol. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 2 h. 50 m.

No excitement, reported new camp of 225 T.S. & 3 H.L.
Entry.59:
Hun Aircraft Patrol. Pilot Lt. Lucis. In air 3 h. 0 m. A quiete trip, can’t see any Huns at all, they seem to avoid me.

Total hours,

Reccos – 223 h. 47 m.

Odd trips – 7 h. 57 m.

Total – 231 h. 44 m.
Entry.61: Test Flight. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 20 m. Tried new piston in gun, went well.
Entry.62: Photos. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 2 h. 55 m., good results obtained.
Entry.64:
B Flight moved up to new aerodrome of Ramleh. A good drome and good situation, in air 25 m.

Photos attempted, in air 45 m., pilot Lt. Lukis.
Entry.65:
Photos. Pilot Lt. Lewis, in air 3 h. 5, all photos spoilt at the wing photo section. 

Photos. Pilot Lt. Mc, in air 2 h.

Films auto. camera jammed.

On first photo trip we (2 machines) met 4 Huns 1000 ft. above us.

Very disquieted and dissapointed that our pilots would not engage, though I urged mine to do so.

fired 50 rounds at Huns.
Entry.66: No photos, too cloudy, spent day digging in tent. First hot day.
Entry.67: Photos. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 3 h. 0 m., exposed 46 plates, expect very successful.
Entry.68: Photos. Pilot Lt. Cameron. In air 3 h.
Entry.69: Photos. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 h. 45 m., cleaned all area up.
Entry.71:
Flew over to Junction Station with E. Headlam in our 2E to see John Webster who is with No. 14 Sqdn. A.F.C. In air 18 m.

John looks well but much knocked about by bomb.
Entry.72: H.A. patroll over the Jordan. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 3 h. 10 m., no excitement.
Entry.73:
Flying times,

Over lines – 244 h. 27 m.

Test etc. – 9 h. 0 m.

Total – 253 h. 27 m.
Entry.74:
On H.A. patroll at 6 a.m. with Addie. In air 2 h. 20 m.

Started out to catch Hun that comes over every morning early.

He did not come over as usuall.
Entry.75:
H.A.P. with Addie, in air 3 h. 5 m.

Patrolled over the L.H. as they attacked Es Salt. No Huns came over.

Addie was lying in his tent when a B.F. taking off crashes into it, was lucky to escape with his life, goes to hospital with a bust knee cap.
Entry.76:
2 B.F.s missing today, no news so far.

Went to see Addie in hospital at Ludd.

Awfully sorry to loose my pilot for a time as Addie is unbeatable in the air and we know one another so well.
Entry.77:
Recco, Lt. Maugham, in air 3 h.

Had a splendid scrap with 3 Huns, drove two of them down but could not see definite results owing to low clouds, fired 450 rounds.
Entry.78:
Walker killed & Williams from 142 Sqdn.

Recco. Pilot Lt. Stooke. In air 2 h. 35 m., great doings since the stunt is on, the L.H. in bad position.

Machine gunned a regiment of Turks and gave them Hell from 1000 ft., fired 600 rounds.
Entry.79:
The L.H. who were in a bad position at Es Salt have withdrawn safely.

H.A. Bombing and machine gunning.

Bombs were not very successful but fired 800 rounds at troops and did good work. Pilot Lt. Cameron, in air 2 h. 35 m.

Could not get Cameron down low enough, fired 800 rounds.
Entry.80: Pilot Lt. Watt, in air 35 m., test engine, test camera and two guns.
Entry.81: Put in for leave from the
Entry.83: Paul drives down a Hun & crushes him. Tonkin gets 2.
Entry.85: of us visited Jaffa, had a lovely swim and after a good afternoon tea at the Hotel Jerusalem.
Entry.86:
Escort to Jenin Hun Aerodrome. In air 1 h. 50 m. Pilot Lt. Paul.

Bombing of 9 machines was good.

Fin drove a Hun down that came up at us.
Entry.88: Gun camera judging distances. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 50 m.
Entry.89: Photos, Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. Uneventfull.
Entry.90:
Taking aspect photos of Hun which was driven down over Turks line. Pilot Lt. Paul.

Excellent photos.

1000 ft. over Hun lines firing like hell at us, fired 200 rounds.

In air 1 h. 30 m.
Entry.91: Photos. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 1 h. 30 m., successful.
Entry.94:
H.A.P. Pilot Lt. McGuinness.

Drove a Hun down onto his aerodrome at Tul Keram.

In air 2 h. 45 m.
Entry.95:
H.A.P.

Pilot Allan Brown.

In air 2 h. 50 m., no excitement.
Entry.96: Played 14th Sqdn. cricket at their ‘drome, we won easily, did not bat.
Entry.99:
Photos. Pilot Lt. McGuinness

Fired 800 rounds.

In air 3 h. 25 m.

Fight took place at 17,000 ft.

Struck a Hun two-seater over Jericho, we chased him going full out almost to Jenin over 40 miles. As we could not catch him opened fire at 250 yards firing over top plane. Hun turned and attempted to beat us off. Fired good burst at 150 yards. Hun hit many times for certain. As ammunition now all used we break off fight and do our photos successfully. Ran out of petrol and landed in a crop near aerodrome, no damage.
Entry.100:
Photos. Pilot Lt. M	cGuinness.

In air 2 h. 45 m.

No Huns seen.

Lt. Tonkin & Cameron brought down in our own lines by a Hun. Dick Cameron shot in wrist.

(German intelegence) machine landed, observer wounded, petrol tanks shot through & many hits on machine.
Entry.102:
H.A.P. Pilot Lt. Addison, in air 2 h. 10 m., forced landing at Jericho. 103rd A.A. Section took us in for the night, a terrible hot night. Jordan valley is Hell.

Took off with Lt. Burton in the 2E, had to return to Jericho. In air 35 m. One of the worst trips I have ever experienced, very releaved to get down. Addie arrives back here.
Entry.103:
Pilot Capt. A. Brown, in air 35 m. Flew back to Ramleh very releaved to be back, just had a good bath.

Played 14th Sqdn. cricket and beat them.

Shepheard 39

Self 23, pulled our side out of the fire.
Entry.104:
Photos & H.A.P. with Addie. In air 3 h. 10 m., uneventful trip.

First trip with Addie since I came back.

Burton crashes in 2E, badly hurt, wonder I was not with him, would have been killed. Should take a Ticket in Tatts after that.
Entry.105: Swim at Jaffa, had a good time.
Entry.106:
H.A.P. with Addie. In air 2 h. 50 m., an uneventful trip, had trouble clearing a vishus stoppage in the air, fixed it.

My guns firing very well.
Entry.107: Played G.H.Q. cricket, we were beaten by 12 runs, they have a splendid team, made 4 runs.
Entry.108: H.A.P. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 3 h., no excitement.
Entry.109: Gun camera work judging distances. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 50 m.
Entry.110:
H.A.P.

Pilot Capt. Addison.

In air 2 h. 40 m., no excitement.
Entry.112:
Escort to bomb raid on Katiani.

Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 2 h. 40 m.

No excitement, bombing not much good.
Entry.114:
Escort bomb raid on Amman station. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 h. 10 m.

Archies at Amman good, no excitement.
Entry.115: Photos. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 h. 20 m., successful.
Entry.117:
H.A.P.

Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 h. 45 m., no excitement.

Played cricket in afternoon.
Entry.119:
H.A.P. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 25 m., dud engine, set out again, in air 2 h. 25 m. 

Saw 4 Hun scouts, our escorts gun jambed so we took them on single handed. Addie gets one with front gun, I get one good burst in, rest driven down under low clouds.
Entry.120:
Escort Bomb raid on Amman. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. 10 m.

R.E.8 forced landing at Jericho, bombing good.
Entry.121:
Total Hours flown,

Over lines – 305 h. 17 m.

Tests, etc. – 11 h. 35 m.

Total – 316 h. 52 m.
Entry.122:
H.A.P. Pilot Capt. Addison. In air 2 h. 50 m., no excitement.

Murphy & Farquhar scrap a Hun over aerodrome. Hun escaped but was on the point of landing. Farquhar killed. A very fine chap and a good sport.
Entry.123:
Photos. Pilot Ltd. Headlam. In air 1 h. 45 m., successful.

Allan Brown & Fin get a Hun. Oxenham & Smith get a Hun but crash alongside at Katiani. Excellent work by them all. Feared Oxenham & Smith killed.
Entry.124: Photos. Pilot Capt. Addison, in air 1 h. 20 m., returned owing to clouds, in air 1 h. 50 m., successful.
Entry.125:
Recco Amman. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. 50 m.

H.A.P. Pilot Lt. Tonkin. In air 2 h. 50 m., no excitement.

We are getting a great deal of work now. Find I can only stick a trip every other day & remain good.
Entry.126: Escort bomb raid on . Pilot Lt. Maughan. In air 2 h. 30 m., bombing good.
Entry.127: Recco Amman. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 55 m., nothing doing.
Entry.129: H.A.P. over our aerodrome. Pilot Lt. Kenny, in air 2 h. 45 m., no excitement.
Entry.130: Recco Amman. Pilot Lt. Lukis, in air 3 h. 5 m., no excitement.
Entry.131: H.A.P. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. 50 m., no excitement.
Entry.132: Swim at Jaffa, a good time.
Entry.133:
H.A.P. 

Pilot Lt. McGuinness in a 250 h.p.

In air 2 h. 55 m., no excitement.
Entry.134: Camera test. Pilot Lt. Lukis, in air 50 m. Saw two Huns but owing to dud engine could not follow them.
Entry.135:
Escort to bomb raid on Upper Wady Fara, bombing indifferent. Came down to 2000 ft. and gave the Jackos Hell. Fired 800 rounds at transport, camps, camels and cavalry.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. 5 m.
Entry.137:
Recco Amman. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 3 h. 5 m.

Took important aspect photos of viaduct & tunnel, saw 2000 camels, machine-gunned them from 2000 ft. and killed a good many, did good recco, fired 400 rounds.
Entry.139:
Total Hours,

Over lines – 343 h. 12 m.

Odd jobs – 11 h. 35 m.

Total – 353 h. 47 m.

including July 16th
Entry.140:
Escort to Photos, visited A’Fuleh .

Pilot Lt. McGuinness.

In air 2 h.
Entry.142:
H.A.P.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 3 h. 10 m., returned dud engine, went out again in another machine.
Entry.143:
Left for leave at Alex. with Lt. McGuinness.

Felt in need of leave.
Entry.146:
Arrived back from Alex., had a splendid leave, a quiete time but plenty of fun.

Feel very benefited.
Entry.147:
Road recco. In air 2 h. 55 m. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. Went as far as Semakh on the Sea of Galille . Flew most of distance at 2000 ft., gunned many cavalry and stations and aerodrome at Semakh & caused a complete panic.

Fired 800 rounds, a good day, felt very fit.
Entry.148:
Standing by for Hun alarm.

Alarm at 12.30 p.m., off ground first & catching up with Hun front when engine went dud frightfully sick. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 25 m.
Entry.149:
Photos.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h., uneventful, photos very good, congratulated.
Entry.150:
Photos & Escort to el-Afaleh & Turkies aerodromes.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 20 m., crashed a Hun 2 seater machine reduced to a heap of rubbish. Gunned troops from 800 ft., fired 700 rounds, did good work. The scrap was great. McGuinness is a great pilot.
Entry.152: Photographs. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 10 m., entirely successful.
Entry.153: Special recco for movement on roads. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. 15 m., m. gunned camels on lines and camps, fired 550 rounds with good effect, height 1500 ft.
Entry.155:
Photos & road recco. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 20 m. Photos from 9,500 ft. under heavy A.A. fire.

Gunned transport, horses and killed a good many.

Height 300 to 1000 ft., fired 700 rounds, also gunned transport.
Entry.158: Recco Katiani. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 45 m. Distance covered 210 miles.
Entry.159:
Recco Turkies aerodrome Nazareth, A’Fuleh aerodrome, Jenin aerodrome.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 3 h. 10 m.

Gunned a train from 200 ft., within 5 miles of Jenin (26 carriages ), gave it hell. Fired 550 rounds. Met 6 Hun scouts over Jenin (2 of us). We drove them all down and shot up two of them.
Entry.161:
Wrote,

G. Fysh

F. Fysh

May Francis

Jack Harvey
Entry.162:
Stand by for Hun alarm. Took off but could not catch Hun.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 1 h. 5 m.

Total hours flown 378 h. 22 m.
Entry.164:
Photos and road recco.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 35 m. No excitement, camera jammed, a good recco.

Stook & Craig killed, dud engine & ran into train.
Entry.165: Road photography. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. 35 m., camera jamms, it is cleared. No excitement.
Entry.166:
Bombing & gunning at Amman & Kissir. Pilot Lt. Towling. In air 2 h. 50 m.

Bombed armoured train, horses etc. with splendid results from 1000 ft.

Gunned transport at Ain es Sir.

Murdered the horses and caused a Hellish panic from 500 ft., fired 1000 rounds.
Entry.167:
Stand by for H.A. alarm.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness.

In air 2 h. 50 m. H.A. of 2 B.F. over our drome, meet a Hun. Walker & Letch brought down in flames.

Capt. Brown & Fin bring Hun down in our lines, both Huns O.K. but machine shot about and crashes.
Entry.168: In bed with a temperature, a touch of fever.
Entry.169:
Better but not well enough to go out.

McGuinness gets 2 Huns. Will I ever have luck in meeting Huns! Luck is all against me, very dissapointed as it would have got me a decoration. Very dissapointed indeed. No notice whatever is taken of long and continuous good work. Fin & Allan Brown get D.F.C.s.
Entry.172:
Feel better.

H.A.P. over drome. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 3 h. 5 m.

Got 2 Hun two-seaters personally.

Both fell to pieces in the air. Very pleased, 1 in our lines, 1 in Enemy lines.

McGuinness did some great piloting enabling me to shoot down the 2 Huns.
Entry.174: Standing by for Hun alarm, nothing doing.
Entry.175:
Photos.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 2 h. 10 m. Successful.

Received D.F.C.
Entry.176:
Standing by for H.A. alarm.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 1 h. 40 m.

Took off twice but could not get at Huns, they were too quick in getting back to earth.
Entry.177:
Headlam, McGuinness & Self go to dinner at 14 Sqdn. had a good night.

Saw Johnnie Webster
Entry.178: H.A.P. over Aerodrome. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 3 h., no excitement.
Entry.180:
Western Recco. Good recco, uninteresting. Archied a good bit, took photos of them.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 5 m.

Total hours flown on service 400 h. 17 m.
Entry.182: Recco & Photos. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h.
Entry.184:
Recco, Jenin, A’Fuleh, Haifa.

Met large 2 seater Rumpler over Jenin, forced him to land 3 miles away from aerodrome, crashed under-carriage. Huns jumped out & ran for it, fired 150 rounds at machine & 200 at machine on ground.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 45 m.
Entry.186:
Recco to Deraa .

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 3 h. 5 m. Landed at Jerusalem and left from there with formation of 7 O.H. 9s who bombed. 1 crashed on way home. Bombing good. Many direct hits. Interesting recco.
Entry.187:
Rounds fired 600, bombs droped 7. 2 Reccos done. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 3 h. In air 2 h. 25 m.

Tonkin & observer shot down, captured and recaptured.

Dowling wounded in leg, Mulford wounded in shoulder.
Entry.188:
Rounds fired 1000, bombs dropped 16. 2 bomb raids on Turkish retreating, great execution done.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 10. In air 2 h. 25.

Bomb raid Semakh, bombed 2 Huns on ground, 1 rendered useless, confirmed by Lt. Vernon.
Entry.189:
Fired 2000, 24 bombs. 3 trips, 2 h. 0, 1 h. 35, 1 h. 15.

Johnnie Webster missing. Saw him go down in a spin and burst into flames. He was evidently shot from the ground, very sorry about it.
Entry.190: Fired 400. Dropped 8 bombs. 1 trip, 2 h. 45 m.
Entry.191: Rounds fired 1700, bombs dropped 16, trips 2, 2 h. 5, 2 h. 0.
Entry.192:
Recco, roads. Pilots Lt. McGuinness & Tonkin.

In air 3 h. 35 m.

Landed at Um es Senab with Arab forces, had an interesting time. Landed at A Fuleh, gone in report, then home.

A Fuleh was old Hun aerodrome.

4 machines intact there.

Wednesday 25 September 1918

3 h. 5 m.

2 h. 50 m.
Entry.193:
trips.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness, dropped 16 bombs, fired 1900 rounds.

Turks now retreating from Amman.

We now have Amman which gives us his whole front. Only a few thousand are left, we have bombed all today.
Entry.194:
Bombing Mafrak. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 30, dropped 8 bombs, fired 1000 rounds, did considerable damage.

Pilot Major Addison.

Flew up to Haifa, landed there, picked out new aerodrome. In air 2 h. 5 m.
Entry.195:
Recco to Damascus. Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 3 h. 55. Landed at A’Fuleh. Total distance 320 miles.

Damascus is a great city from the air.

Took photos. The wonderful stunt is drawing to a close as regards bombing. First machine over Damascus.
Entry.196:
Bomb raid to Hun aerodrome at Damascus. Huns had flown except one machine, it was well bombed & gunned. Fired 800 rounds, dropped 8 bombs, in air 3 h. 40.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness, did splendid shooting at Hun, must have damaged him.

Engine very dud, glad to arrive Home.
Entry.197:
Orderly Officer carrying despatches to Prince Feisel head of the Hejaz which is co-operating with. Dropped despatches on him North of Deraa.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 3 h. 0 m. A good trip.
Entry.198:
Road recco.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 4h.

A long trip.

Beirut & Rayak.
Entry.199:
Recco, Rayak, Damascus.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 5 h.

Our troops in Damascus 3000. Turks escaping to the North bombed and gunned, dropped 8 bombs, fired 500 rounds.

For 13 days, 55 h. 25 m., bombs 111, rounds fired 10,500.

 Have done record flying for Sqdn.
Entry.200:
Escort to Recco Rayak.

Pilot Ltd. McGuinness, in air 3 h. 15 m., fired 350 rounds. Turks evacuated Rayak.

Landed at Haifa at new aerodrome. A lovely camp right by the sea.
Entry.201:
Having a great spell in our lovely new camp at Haifa by the sea.

First shower of rain about 20 points.

McGuinness & Self have record hours flying for the stunt, 55 hours.
Entry.202: Tent fixed up, all camp in order. Maughan, Tonkin, Ross Smith, Mustard & Ned Henry get D.F.C., very glad to hear it. Smith & Mustard got it very backsheesh.
Entry.203:
Photographic recco to Rayak. Turks have completely gone. Dropped 8 bombs on Bedouins looting.

Pilot Lt. McGuinness. In air 2 h. 40 m.

Went shooting partridge on Mt. Carmel, quite fine spot. Ginty & self got 5 lovely birds.
Entry.204:
Shooting again, very bad shooting, only got 1 bird.

Hours flown on active service, 469 h. 27 m.
Entry.206:
Recco returned. Pilot Lt. McGuinness, in air 20 m.

This is the last trip I had on active service & is the only one on which McGuinness & self have had to return through engine trouble, except on one occasion when a dressing plug blew out. Trouble overheating, water trouble.
Entry.208: Left Haifa for Ramleh and thense to Cairo. At last we go to the school, Finlay, Mustard, Beaton, Sutherland & Self.
Entry.217:
Turkey throws in the towell.

Very satisfied with it, but we have no celebrations, having a quiete time.
Entry.218: Arrived at Aboukir aerodrome from Manieh Hospital Cairo.
Entry.221:
Now I am certain of getting Home again which I never really expected to do. I have started to take more care of myself & also money. We are all practically tea-total which avows our good sense.

I put in time playing tennis & golf mostly. We are having a really quiete restful time after a long spell of active service.

Flying here is no strain on one at all, it is only a pleasure.

We are flying Avios.
Entry.223: Finlay, Mustard, Beaton & Self have our Xmas Dinner at the Majestic Hotel, Alex. Had quite a gay time but were sober enough to play a game of snooker after dinner.
Entry.224: Cable from Home, telling Uncle Willy died on
Entry.225: Very sorry about it as I thought a lot of Uncle Willy, he was always a good friend to the ones at Home. Decide to give up trip to England & America at once & proceed Home at earliest opportunity.
